meanings.definition: In a way that lacks emphasis or stress.
meanings.sent1: She spoke unemphatically during the presentation, barely raising her voice.
meanings.sent2: He answered unemphatically, showing little enthusiasm.
meanings.sent3: The comedian delivered his punchline unemphatically, catching the audience off guard.
meanings.sent4: Her words landed unemphatically, failing to make an impact on the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The music played unemphatically in the background, almost unnoticed.

meanings.sent1: He sang unemphatically, not wanting to overpower the melody.
meanings.sent2: The actor delivered his lines unemphatically, focusing on subtlety.
meanings.sent3: The chef seasoned the dish unemphatically, resulting in a bland taste.
meanings.sent4: The wind whispered unemphatically through the trees, barely rustling the leaves.
meanings.sent5: The student presented his project unemphatically, lacking confidence in his work.

meanings.definition: Not giving special importance or attention.
meanings.sent1: She made an unemphatic entrance, quietly slipping into the room.
meanings.sent2: The unemphatic response indicated a lack of interest in the topic.
meanings.sent3: The unemphatic decoration in the room went unnoticed by most guests.
meanings.sent4: His unemphatic gestures failed to convey the urgency of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The unemphatic color choice for the walls made the room feel dull and uninspired.
